segments.text: We identified service boundaries using domain-driven design principles.

segments.text: Our event-driven architecture enables loose coupling between services.

segments.text: We process over 500 million events per day through our message bus.

segments.text: Before we wrap up completely, I want to provide additional financial context that didn't fit in my earlier presentation.

segments.text: Let me walk through our regional revenue breakdown and discuss some important trends we're seeing across different markets.

segments.text: North America continues to be our strongest market, representing forty-seven percent of total revenue this quarter.
segments.raw_text: <v Kevin O'Brien>North America continues to be our strongest market, representing forty-seven percent of total revenue this quarter.

segments.text: That's up from forty-three percent last year, showing strong momentum in our home market.
segments.raw_text: <v Kevin O'Brien>That's up from forty-three percent last year, showing strong momentum in our home market.

segments.speaker: Kevin O'Brien
segments.text: European markets account for twenty-eight percent of revenue, with Germany, UK, and France leading the region.

segments.text: We've seen particularly strong growth in the DACH region, up eighteen percent year over year.

segments.text: Asia Pacific represents nineteen percent of revenue, with Australia and Japan being our largest markets there.

segments.text: We're making significant investments in Southeast Asia, particularly Singapore and Vietnam.

segments.text: Latin America and other emerging markets account for the remaining six percent.
segments.raw_text: <v Kevin O'Brien>Latin America and other emerging markets account for the remaining six percent.
